NewsDetail.Name: Taking the University to the Church
NewsDetail.Title: Taking the University to the Church
NewsDetail.Abstract: Online classes and technological developments help to give students an education at BYU-Idaho, even if they do not live in Rexburg.
NewsDetail.Author: Justin Murdock
NewsDetail.BodyCopy:
Members of the church have just as much of a commitment to education as they do for the gospel. "The university will continue to grow and strengthen as a place that focuses on teaching and learning," said President Clark in an interview with the BYU-Idaho magazine. "It's really a student-centered place." Because of the blessing participating at this university has been, the school has made efforts to expand its availability to students not living in Rexburg through the use of the Online Learning department.


Today, many students' lives are blessed as they learn under the guidance of qualified professionals in a religious atmosphere, aided by new tools available to online classes. BYU-Idaho's pathway program is also helping to make courses available to students who are not able to attend college in Rexburg. The church is committed to integrating technology into online degrees, improving the quality of courses and allowing students to better themselves.


"We have been blessed with technologies that are allowing us to teach and learn in different ways; in new ways that are very powerful here on campus, but also allow us to take the university and the education we offer to the church."

-President Clark
